alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cape May; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:34PM EDT until October 01 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Atlantic, Cape May and Southeastern Burlington. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will remain elevated into early next week, with minor or near minor tidal flooding possible again around the morning high tides Monday and Tuesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Atlantic Ocean at Atlantic City MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 30/09 PM 6.3 1.7 1.3 Minor 01/09 AM 6.6 2.0 1.3 Minor 01/10 PM 5.9 1.3 1.2 None 02/10 AM 6.1 1.5 0.9 Minor 02/11 PM 5.2 0.6 0.9 None 03/11 AM 5.8 1.2 0.8 None Great Egg Harbor Bay at Ocean City MLLW Categories - Minor 5.3 ft, Moderate 6.3 ft, Major 7.3 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 30/09 PM 5.6 1.6 1.0 Minor 01/10 AM 5.9 1.9 0.8 Minor 01/10 PM 5.0 1.0 0.7 None 02/11 AM 5.5 1.5 0.5 Minor 02/11 PM 4.4 0.4 0.4 None 03/11 AM 5.1 1.1 0.4 None Cape May Harbor at Cape May MLLW Categories - Minor 6.2 ft, Moderate 7.2 ft, Major 8.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.1 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 3.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 30/10 PM 6.6 1.5 1.0 Minor 01/10 AM 6.9 1.8 0.9 Minor 01/10 PM 6.1 1.0 0.9 None 02/11 AM 6.4 1.3 0.6 Minor 02/11 PM 5.3 0.2 0.5 None 03/11 AM 6.0 0.9 0.5 None Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 30/09 PM 3.9 1.4 1.0 Minor 01/10 AM 4.0 1.5 0.8 Minor 01/10 PM 3.4 0.9 0.7 None 02/10 AM 3.6 1.1 0.5 Minor 02/11 PM 3.0 0.5 0.5 None 03/11 AM 3.4 0.9 0.4 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
